channel.title: Regular Expressions :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: CONSOLE The JavaScript String prototype has some very powerful methods, such as String.prototype.includes() which recognizes when a string contains a substring - i.e.: "foobarwhen".includes("bar")would evaluate to true. But what if you needed a more general solution? Say, to see if the text matched a phone number pattern like XXX-XXX-XXXX? Thatâ€™s where Regular Expressions come in. Regular Expressions are a sequence of characters that define a pattern that can be searched for within a string.
